meanings.definition: To spin or cause to spin rapidly.
meanings.sent1: She birls around in her twirly dress.
meanings.sent2: The colorful pinwheel birls in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The dancer birls so fast, she looks like a blur!
meanings.sent4: Time birls by quickly when you're having fun.
meanings.sent5: The tornado birls through the town, causing chaos.
meanings.sent6: The little girl birls happily in the playground.
meanings.sent7: The fan birls above, cooling the room.
meanings.sent8: The ice skater birls gracefully on the frozen pond.

meanings.sent1: The birls of the spinning top fascinated the child.
meanings.sent2: The birls of the carousel made her dizzy.
meanings.sent3: The birls of the ballerina's tutu added to her performance.
meanings.sent4: The birls of the hurricane caused widespread destruction.
meanings.sent5: The birls of the planets around the sun create the solar system.
meanings.sent6: The birls of the record player filled the room with music.
meanings.sent7: The birls of the merry-go-round delighted the children at the park.
meanings.sent8: The birls of the clock's hands marked the passing of time.

meanings.sent1: He played with the birls for hours, mesmerized by their movement.
meanings.sent2: The children raced their birls down the hill.
meanings.sent3: The birls spun faster and faster as the string unwound.
meanings.sent4: The colorful birls sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The wooden birls clattered as they spun on the floor.
meanings.sent6: The metal birls gleamed in the toy store's display.
meanings.sent7: The birls whirred as they spun on the tabletop.
meanings.sent8: The birls collided with a clatter, creating a playful chaos.
